00031 Readable* XmlReader::deserialize(cstr s) throw (ReadingException)
00032 {
00033     reader = xmlReaderForMemory(s.c_str(), s.size(), 0, XML_ENCODING, 0);
00034     XML_CHECK_ERROR(!reader, "Cannot create xmlTextReader", 0);
00035 
00036     innerObjects = 0;
00037     Readable* r = readObject();
00038 
00039     xmlFreeTextReader(reader);
00040     return r;
00041 }
00042 
00043 void XmlReader::deserialize(cstr s, Readable* readable) throw (ReadingException)
00044 {
00045     reader = xmlReaderForMemory(s.c_str(), s.size(), 0, XML_ENCODING, 0);
00046     XML_CHECK_ERROR(!reader, "Cannot create xmlTextReader", );
00047 
00048     innerObjects = 0;
00049     readObject(readable);
00050 
00051     xmlFreeTextReader(reader);
00052 }
00053 
00054 void XmlReader::iWantAnElement(cstr elementName, bool dontCareIfEmpty) throw (ReadingException)
00055 {
00056     if (!goToElementOrEndElement()) {
00057         throwIt(string() + "I was looking for the element '" + elementName + "' but the stream has finished");
00058     }
00059     if (xmlTextReaderNodeType(reader) == XML_READER_TYPE_END_ELEMENT) {
00060         const char* xs = (const char*) xmlTextReaderConstName(reader);
00061         throwIt(string() + "I was looking for the element '" + elementName 
00062             + "' but I found the end of the element '" + string(xs ? xs : "") + "'");
00063     }
00064     if (xmlStrcmp(BAD_CAST elementName.c_str(), xmlTextReaderConstName(reader)) != 0) {
00065         const char* xs = (const char*) xmlTextReaderConstName(reader);
00066         throwIt(string() + "I was looking for the element '" + elementName 
00067             + "' but I found the element '" + string(xs ? xs : "") + "'");
00068     }
00069     if (!dontCareIfEmpty) {
00070         if (xmlTextReaderIsEmptyElement(reader)) currentElementIsEmpty = true;
00071         else currentElementIsEmpty = false;
00072     }
00073 }
00074 
00075 void XmlReader::iWantANamedElement(cstr elementName, cstr name, bool dontCareIfEmpty) throw (ReadingException)
00076 {
00077     try {
00078         iWantAnElement(elementName, dontCareIfEmpty);
00079     } catch (ReadingException e) {
00080         // We tell the name of the attribute: it's useful for
00081         // debugging
00082         RDK_ERROR_STREAM("Unable to read element named '" << name
00083                  << "'");
00084         throw e;
00085     }
00086     if (name != "" && getAttributeValue("name") != name) {
00087         throwIt(string() + "Expected element with name '" + name + "', got '" + getAttributeValue("name") + "'");
00088     }
00089 }
00090 
00091 std::string XmlReader::getAttributeValue(cstr attributeName) throw (ReadingException)
00092 {
00093     xmlChar* tmp = xmlTextReaderGetAttribute(reader, BAD_CAST attributeName.c_str());
00094     string s((tmp ? (const char*) tmp : ""));
00095     xmlFree(tmp);
00096     return s;
00097 }
00098 
00099 void XmlReader::iWantAnEndElement(cstr elementName) throw (ReadingException)
00100 {
00101     if (currentElementIsEmpty) return;
00102     if (!goToElementOrEndElement()) {
00103         throwIt(string() + "I was looking for the end of element '" + elementName + "' but the stream has finished");
00104     }
00105     if (xmlTextReaderNodeType(reader) == XML_READER_TYPE_ELEMENT) {
00106         const char* xs = (const char*) xmlTextReaderConstName(reader);
00107         throwIt(string() + "I was looking for the end of element '" + elementName 
00108             + "' but I found the element '" + string(xs ? xs : "") + "'");
00109     }
00110     if (xmlStrcmp(BAD_CAST elementName.c_str(), xmlTextReaderConstName(reader)) != 0) {
00111         const char* xs = (const char*) xmlTextReaderConstName(reader);
00112         throwIt(string() + "I was looking for the end of element '" + elementName 
00113             + "' but I found the end of element '" 
00114             + string(xs ? xs : "") + "'");
00115     }
00116 }
00117 
00118 bool XmlReader::goToElementOrEndElement()
00119 {
00120     if (alreadyRead) {
00121         alreadyRead = false;
00122         return true;
00123     }
00124     if (checkBeforeGoingToNext && 
00125     (xmlTextReaderNodeType(reader) == XML_READER_TYPE_ELEMENT
00126     || xmlTextReaderNodeType(reader) == XML_READER_TYPE_END_ELEMENT)) {
00127         checkBeforeGoingToNext = false;
00128         return true;
00129     }
00130     int r = 1;
00131     while ((r = xmlTextReaderRead(reader)) > 0
00132     && xmlTextReaderNodeType(reader) != XML_READER_TYPE_ELEMENT
00133     && xmlTextReaderNodeType(reader) != XML_READER_TYPE_END_ELEMENT) ;
00134     checkBeforeGoingToNext = false;
00135     return r > 0;
00136 }
00137 
00138 unsigned char XmlReader::startReading(cstr className) throw (ReadingException)
00139 {
00140     iWantANamedElement("rdk:object", curObjectName, false);
00141     if (getAttributeValue("class") != className) 
00142         throwIt(string() + "Wrong class found, expected '" + className + 
00143             "', got '" + getAttributeValue("class") + "'");
00144     innerObjects++;
00145     string verStr = getAttributeValue("version");
00146     int vers = (verStr == "") ? 1 : atoi(verStr.c_str());
00147     return (unsigned char) vers;
00148 }

00150 uint8_t XmlReader::read_u8(cstr name) throw (ReadingException)
00151 {
00152     iWantANamedElement("rdk:uint8", name);
00153     return atoi(getAttributeValue("value").c_str());
00154 }

00186 void XmlReader::readBytes(void** buffer, size_t* n, cstr name) throw (ReadingException)
00187 {
00188     iWantANamedElement("rdk:buffer64", name, false);
00189     xmlTextReaderRead(reader);
00190     string s;
00191     size_t nn;
00192     const char* xs = (const char*) xmlTextReaderConstValue(reader);
00193     decode64(string(xs ? xs : ""), s, nn);
00194     iWantAnEndElement("rdk:buffer64");
00195     
00196     *buffer = new char[s.size()];
00197     memcpy(*buffer, s.data(), s.size());
00198     *n = nn;
00199 }
00200 
00201 void XmlReader::iWantANamedElementArrayOfType(cstr name, cstr type) throw (ReadingException)
00202 {
00203     iWantANamedElement("rdk:array", name);
00204     if (getAttributeValue("type") != type) {
00205         throwIt(string() + "I expected an array of " + type +
00206             ", but got an array of " + getAttributeValue("type"));
00207     }
00208 }
00209 
00210 void XmlReader::readArrayOfBytes(uint8_t** a, size_t *n) throw (ReadingException)
00211 {
00212     size_t sz = atoi(getAttributeValue("size").c_str());
00213     xmlTextReaderRead(reader);
00214     if (sz == 0) throwIt("No 'size' attribute in array element");
00215     *a = new uint8_t[sz];
00216     const char* xs = (const char*) xmlTextReaderConstValue(reader);
00217     stringstream ss(string(xs ? xs : ""));
00218     for (size_t i = 0; i < sz; i++) {
00219         int q;
00220         bool b = (ss >> q);
00221         (*a)[i] = (uint8_t) q;
00222         if (!b) 
00223             throwIt(string() + "I expected more array values (string was: '" 
00224                 + ss.str() + "')");
00225     }
00226     *n = sz;
00227 }
00228 
00229 void XmlReader::read_i8(int8_t** a, size_t* n, cstr name) throw (ReadingException)
00230 {
00231     iWantANamedElementArrayOfType(name, "int8");
00232     readArrayOfBytes((uint8_t**) a, n);
00233     for (size_t i = 0; i < *n; i++) cerr << (*a)[i] << " ";
00234     cerr << endl;
00235     iWantAnEndElement("rdk:array");
00236 }
00237 
00238 void XmlReader::read_u8(uint8_t** a, size_t* n, cstr name) throw (ReadingException)
00239 {
00240     iWantANamedElementArrayOfType(name, "uint8");
00241     readArrayOfBytes(a, n);
00242     iWantAnEndElement("rdk:array");
00243 }

00249     iWantAnEndElement("rdk:array");

00274 // FIXME 
00275 // In questo caso:
00276 //
00277 //    <rdk:object class='RString' xmlns:rdk='http://sied.dis.uniroma1.it/rdk'>                         
00278 //      <rdk:string/>                                                                                  
00279 //    </rdk:object>
00280 //
00281 // questa funzione restituisce "\n" e non "", infatti non controlla se l'elemento
00282 // rdk:string e' vuoto e passa al frammento di testo successivo (fra rdk:string 
00283 // e rdk:object)
00284 
00285 std::string XmlReader::readString(cstr name) throw (ReadingException)
00286 {
00287     iWantANamedElement("rdk:string", name, false);
00288     xmlTextReaderRead(reader);
00289     const char* cv = (const char*) xmlTextReaderConstValue(reader);
00290     if(!cv) {
00291         // stringa vuota
00292         return "";
00293     }
00294     xmlChar* encstr = xmlDecode(cv);
00295     if(!encstr) {
00296         RDK_ERROR_STREAM("xmlDecode failed");
00297         throwIt("could not decode string (xmlDecode failed)");  
00298     }
00299     
00300     string s((const char*) encstr);
00301     xmlFree(encstr);
00302     iWantAnEndElement("rdk:string");
00303     return s;
00304 }
00305 
00306 void XmlReader::readObject(Readable* r, cstr name) throw (ReadingException)
00307 {
00308     curObjectName = name;
00309     int curInnerObject = innerObjects;
00310     r->read(this);
00311     if (innerObjects != curInnerObject) {
00312         throwIt("The object did not call doneReading()");
00313     }
00314 }
00315 
00316 Readable* XmlReader::readObject(cstr name) throw (ReadingException)
00317 {
00318     iWantANamedElement("rdk:object", name);
00319     alreadyRead = true;
00320     Readable* r = RDK2::Meta::forName(getAttributeValue("class").c_str()); //instantiate
00321     if (!r) {
00322         throwIt(string() + "Could not instantiate object of class" + getAttributeValue("class"));
00323     }
00324     readObject(r, name);
00325     return r;
00326 }
00327 
00328 void XmlReader::doneReading() throw (ReadingException)
00329 {
00330     iWantAnEndElement("rdk:object");
00331     innerObjects--;
00332 }
00333 
00334 void XmlReader::throwIt(cstr errorMessage) throw (ReadingException)
00335 {
00336     throw ReadingException(errorMessage);
00337 }
